org.locationtech.geowave.adapter.vector

Class FeatureDataAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.locationtech.geowave.adapter.vector.FeatureDataAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeotoolsFeatureDataAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>, Persistable, DataTypeAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>, DataReader<Object>, DataWriter<Object>, DefaultStatisticsProvider, HadoopDataAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature,FeatureWritable>

    public class FeatureDataAdapter
extends Object
implements GeotoolsFeatureDataAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature>, HadoopDataAdapter<org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature,FeatureWritable>, DefaultStatisticsProvider
    This data adapter will handle all reading/writing concerns for storing and retrieving GeoTools SimpleFeature objects to and from a GeoWave persistent store.

    The adapter will use the SimpleFeature's default geometry for spatial indexing.

    The adaptor will use the first temporal attribute (a Calendar or Date object) as the timestamp of a temporal index.

    If the feature type contains a UserData property 'time' for a specific time attribute with Boolean.TRUE, then the attribute is used as the timestamp of a temporal index.

    If the feature type contains UserData properties 'start' and 'end' for two different time attributes with value Boolean.TRUE, then the attributes are used for a range index.

    If the feature type contains a UserData property 'time' for *all* time attributes with Boolean.FALSE, then a temporal index is not used.
